events.name: Jenkins Users Sharing Sessions
events.description: In this meetup, we will have some members sharing with us their stories of implementing Jenkins in their companies. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from those who had "been there, done that"! Agenda 6.30pm to 6.45pm - Eat, drink & chit-chat6.45pm to 7.30pm - Jenkins adoption at Zyllem by Florian Poulin & Vo Trung Hung7.30pm to 8.00pm - Jenkins for CD at Titansoft by Vignesh Rajasekaran8.00pm to 8.30pm - Jenkins with NetApp by Bikash Roy Choudhury8.30pm to 9.00pm - Open discussions  Topic #1: Jenkins adoption at Zyllem [45 mins] This talk is a sharing of how Jenkins is being used in Zyllem, covering: • what it was like before• what they have built so far• what they are planning for the future Topic #2: Jenkins for CD at Titansoft [30 mins] This talk will give an example of how Jenkins is being used for Continuous Delivery for a .NET web application. The topics that will be covered are, • A brief background about the architecture of the system to understand the context• How is the deployment pipeline implemented• Usage of master and slaves and why they are required• What are the plugins that are being used• How do we control permissions for release• What is the current lead time• Issues faced with Jenkins• Future enhancements Speaker Profile: Vignesh is a Technical Coach at Titansoft Singapore. He is a Computer Science graduate from NUS. Currently he is focusing on reducing the lead time at Titansoft which has exposed him into DevOps, CD, containers and automation.  Topic #3: Jenkins with NetApp [30 mins] This talk will cover the following: • Continuous Integration Pipeline with Cloudbees Jenkins and NetApp.• Horizontal scaling with Docker containers in the compute layer and at the storage layer.• Persistent storage with Docker containers on NetApp.• Integrations using ONTAP APIs.• Reducing build times, improving developer productivity and reducing storage efficiency. Speaker Profile: Bikash Roy Choudhury is a principal architect at NetApp. He is responsible for designing and architecting solutions for DevOps workflows relevant across industry verticals including high tech, financial services, gaming, social media, and web-based development organizations that address customer business requirements in these markets. He also works on validating solutions with Red Hat (RHOSP-IaaS), Apprenda (PaaS), Docker Containers, CloudBees Jenkins, and Perforce Helix using RESTful APIs and integrating them with NetApp ONTAP software in private, hybrid, and public clouds. In his current role, Bikash drives integrations with strategic DevOps partners, including Red Hat, CloudBees, Perforce, Apprenda, JFrog Artifactory, Chef, and Iron.io.  Bikash has over 16 years of data management and storage experience. Before joining NetApp, he worked for five years at key accounts as a professional services engineer. For three years he was a systems administrator working on various UNIX platforms. Bikash received an MSCIS from the University of Phoenix, San Jose, and a BSc in computer science engineering from a distinguished engineering college in India. *** Note: This meetup is free for all to attend ***
events.location: NetApp Singapore Pte Ltd, 1 Temasek Avenue, #08-01, Millenia Tower

events.name: September Ruby Meetup
events.description: Hi folks! We look forward to having you join us for our September meetup,on the 20th of September at 7pm. Venue: Pivotal Labs Singapore, 53 Craig Road #02-00, S089691 Ping us (Winston or Guo Xiang) if your company would like tosponsor or if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Ruby Tips. -------------- 1. "RuboCop Internals - A Gentle Introduction" by @drenmi from @tinkerbox 2. "Tips from The Ruby Closures Book" by @tgx_world from @discourse  4. "Ruby Kaigi Sharings" by @winstonyw from Singapore Power 3. 5 Random Ruby tips - "Yangyu" 4. Announcements * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com,or Guo Xiang @tgx_world / tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. 1) Mobile Market Monitor Looking for highly motivated and proactive full-stack developers for our Singapore office! We're a US-based tech company that utilises user travel data for transport model planning and we're currently working on a collaborative project with the Singapore LTA. More details here: http://bit.ly/2csrTAZ -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Venu  Food

events.name: Come and learn about Lean UX!
events.description: Sign up here http://bit.ly/2co4oXb What is Lean UX and how do you use it to improve on your product? What’s the best way to do it ‘Quick & Dirty’? [ Who should join ] 。People who want to learn the fundamentals of UX 。Aspiring entrepreneurs who want to build their own product or improve on an existing one [ What you will learn ] 。Fundamentals of UX 。How to do it quick and dirty, learn fast, iterate faster [ Workshop details ] 。Date: 20 Sep 。Time: 7.30pm - 9.30pm 。Venue: The Co. @ 99 Duxton 。Price: SGD 15 (Fully refundable at the end of the workshop) *Admittance to the workshop is strictly for people who paid for the event only. ** Please bring your own MacBook. [ Instructor ] Doralin Kelly UX/UI Design Ninja Design Ninja and Star Wars fan girl. I run my own design practice between SG & NYC. I work with awesome startups and global brands on everything from branding to UX/UI design for websites and mobile apps. ______ Policy: 1. ALPHA Camp reserves the right to cancel or postpone the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In the event that the workshop is cancelled or postponed, all paid participants will be informed via email and full-refund will be given. 2. Full refund will be made after participants have attended the workshop. The amount will be credited back to the credit card and will be shown in your bank account statement in 5-10 working days. 3. The full amount will be forfeited for no-show to ensure a seat is allocated to genuinely interested individuals. Thank you!
